description.narrative:
Small-scale farmers in Vietnam are at the high risk of being excluded from the development of modern commercialised agriculture. There are existing examples in rural Vietnam proved that small scale farmers are capable to involve as active players in the markets through a strong collaboration with each other and connecting with businesses, and other market actors. This brings benefits to all actors involved, while conserving natural resources, promoting women leadership, and securing land right of small holder farmers. Such the initiatives need more attention from policy makers for further replication as an alternative for new approaches to agricultural development with relation to reduced land inequality.
This project will produce a paper that presentsuch cases to bring attentionto policy makers for further replication as an alternative for new approaches to agricultural development with relation to reduced land inequality. This paper will present a case of small-scale farmers (majority are women farmers) organised into production groupsand cooperatives, in which they merged their land into larger production area. They also applied good agro-ecological practices in producing different commodities (vegetable, fruit trees, rice, fish, chicken), connect with food dealers/distributors and reach consumers in high quality food market. As the results of this establishment, farmers harvest better quality commodities, stable market for their produces and improved income. Soil fertility and environment conditions also improved.
The gender dimension of the paper is as follows: # Gender power analysis and gender lenses integrated in all the tools and process of investigation, analysis of the good practices. # Approaches/practices that promote women empowerment, women leadership along the development and implementation of the innovation will be a focus of investigation and analysis; # Practical solutions, institutions arrangements and legal provisions that bring positive impacts on gender equality will bepromoted.
The project will be implemented from February 2020 to May 2020.
